article are not met e gates and fencing the times at which the gates will be open as well as provisions for maintaining the fence at locations required herein shall be indicated f vector control the intended continuing vector control principally rat abatement and mosquito abatement shall be indicated g personnel and equipment the personnel and equipment planned to operate the site and the hours and days of the week when they will be on the site shall be indicated 1985  45a10 summary of environmental controls expected environmental impact problems with specific treatment or controls intended to eliminate or mitigate negative effects of each shall be listed 1985  45a11 insurance the applicant shall file a certificate of insurance evidencing the issuance to the applicant of liability insurance which shall protect the public and any and all persons from injury which may be sustained by reason of the operation or condition of the landfill and that the applicant carries insurance which meets the requirements of the iowa workmens compensation law proof of such insurance shall show a minimum cancellation time of ten 10 days and shall embody a requirement that the city shall have a right to such notice before such cancellation can become effective the proof shall specify evidence of the following forms of insurance protection a operation liability liability insurance covering all operations performed by the licensed applicant and all persons in the licensed applicants direct employment b subcontractor public liability insurance covering all operations performed by any subcontractor or independent contractor to whom a portion of the operations may have been assigned or which in the future may be assigned or by any person or legal entity action for or on behalf of the licensed applicant at or on the site  sterling codifiers inc  249687 c vehicles motor vehicle bodily injury insurance and property damage liability insurance on motor vehicles employed on the site whether or not owned by the licensed applicant or by either the subcontractors or independent contractors under contract to the licensee or by any other person or legal entity acting for or on behalf of the licensed applicant at or on the site d amount the main protection shall be insurance coverage with a minimum liability of one million dollars $100000000 for the injury or death of any one person and subject to the same limit per person a minimum liability of one million dollars $100000000 for the injury or death of any number of persons in one accident and a minimum liability of one million dollars $100000000 for damage to property of others but excluding property of the insured the insurance certificate shall provide that notice shall be given to the city clerk thirty 30 days prior to any cancellation or termination of insurance the cancellation or termination of the insurance shall automatically revoke the permit e additional insured the city shall be named as an additional insured under all liability policies without expense to it 1985   amd 1993  45a12 license fee an annual license fee of one hundred dollars $10000 payable to the finance director of the city shall accompany the initial application for license and each application for renewal of the license 1985   amd 1993   eff 9172010 45a13 renewal requirements applications for renewal need comply with the documentation requirements of sections 45a2 a11 of this article only in the event there has been a substantial change in the conditions or circumstances on or off the site which significantly affect the proposed operation or its effects during the proposed renewal period except that a showing must be made in such application that required insurance is in force and has continued in force during the current license year the application for such renewal must specifically negate or affirm the existence of any such circumstances or conditions and be documented accordingly the application for renewal must also be accompanied by a showing of a current permit issued by the appropriate state agency for the operation of the construction or demolition materials landfill site the building inspector upon receipt of such application for renewal shall process the same as though it were an initial application for license and shall report his findings and recommendations thereon which shall be reviewed by the council before issuance of the renewal 1985  45a14 site accessibility the location of the fence and gates which shall be provided to exclude people from the active fill site shall be shown they shall be located to prevent illegal dumping children from playing on the site and debris from being blown off the site the fence shall be at least six feet 6 high and composed of a metal fabric and it shall comply with all street intersection setback requirements the fence shall be constructed before landfill operations begin for purposes of this requirement active fill site shall mean that portion of the land covered by the license which is in fact regularly receiving waste whether or not at the instance of the applicant the applicant shall maintain any unfenced area free of solid waste and in the event of accumulation of waste upon or abutting the site the building inspector may require the applicant to install such further fencing as can assure that the thenactive remainder of the site shall remain free of unauthorized or improper accumulation of solid waste 1985  45a15 signing a prominent legible sign shall be provided at all site entrances indicating the name of the site owner and operator and emergency telephone numbers 1985  45a16 public agencies neither the city or any other public agency shall be required to obtain the license required by this but each such public body shall file with the council before beginning operation and annually thereafter evidence of substantial compliance with all provisions of this the requirements of a4 of this is however specifically provided that such exemption from licensing shall not operate to exempt the city or other public agencies from any other specific requirements of law relating to or regulating such operation to which such operation would otherwise be subject 1985  45a17 plan content mandatory the operational details and physical site proposals contained in the plans filed with an application which has been approved by the city council shall be obligatory and binding upon the licensee who shall conform to each such detail and proposal unless specifically relieved of such conformance by the council 1985  45a18 revocation or denial of license renewal in the event a licensee violates any section of this as well as those made obligatory and binding upon the licensee by reason of their inclusion in the application and approval by the council or other city ordinances then the city manager shall report the same to the council which shall set a public hearing thereon and direct that the notice of the time date and place of said public hearing and of the city managers report be given to the licensee such hearing shall occur not less than ten 10 days after such notice has been mailed to the licensee at the address shown in the application or such other address as has been provided by the licensee during the period of license if upon said hearing the council determines noncompliance by the licensee the council may revoke or suspend the license or if such determination be made while an application for renewal is pending may deny renewal of the  sterling codifiers inc  250687 license notice of such revocation or denial following such hearing may be either by formal notice to the licensee at the appropriate address or by so advising representatives of the licensee personally present at such hearing or by any other means reasonably calculated to apprise the licensee of such revocation or such denial no person or other legal entity whose license shall have been revoked or the renewal thereof denied pursuant to this no successors or assigns or other legal entities in which such person or other legal entity shall have a substantial interest may obtain a license pursuant to this the city for a period of two 2 years from date of cessation of activities at such landfill site pursuant to such revocation or denial the operation of a disposal site without having a presently valid license to do so shall be and is hereby prohibited 1985  article b transfer stations 45b1 purpose the purpose of this to regulate the location and operation of solid waste transfer stations 1985  45b2 license required no person shall operate or permit the operation on its property of a transfer station in the city unless such person shall have first applied for and received a license to do so from the city a license to operate a transfer station shall be issued by the council upon application filed with the building inspector of the city and accompanied by a special use permit issued by the city board of adjustment and a state permit issued by the appropriate state agency to conduct a transfer station operation on the site in question the applicant must show proof that he can demonstrate full present and contemplated compliance with the specific provisions of this the operational details and physical site proposals contained in plans accompanying the application as well as the ability to do so  and shall be subject to annual renewal by the council as hereinafter set forth in reviewing such application the council must weigh the need for the transfer station against the potential for site pollution danger to persons or property likely to have direct or indirect contact with the site the feasibility of the operation the likelihood of freedom from negative environmental effect of such operation and such other factors as shall reflect the public interest in balance against the interests of the applicant to operate such a facility on the site in question 1985  45b3 application the application for a license to operate a transfer station shall be accompanied by plans prepared under the direct supervision of a registered engineer in conformity with chapter 114 of the iowa the site as shown on the plans shall physically conform to the following requirements and the application shall contain either sufficient written information to show such conformity or it shall be shown by depiction of physical detail on the plan as applicable 1985  a site the site shall be located outside flood plain or riverfront land unless such requirement is waived by the appropriate governmental agency or agencies the boundaries of the site shall be shown on the plan with sufficient data including legal description that a land surveyor can easily locate the boundaries two foot 2 contours of the existing terrain shall likewise be shown on the plan proposed screening of the site from highways streets parks residences and other amenities as well as the schedule of installation of such shall be shown  such screening shall meet the requirements of the zoning ordinance and shall have been demonstrated to and approved by the city board of adjustment the site shall be enclosed with a chain link fence not less than six feet 6 in height which fence shall completely surround all portions of the site intended to be used in connection with the operation of the transfer station the location of such fence shall be shown on the plan b permits the application will be accompanied by a copy of the special use permit issued for such operation by the city board of adjustment and by a copy of the permit issued by the applicable state agency each approving the operation of a transfer station on the site c vehicular travel the plan shall show the areas on the site over which haul vehicles and transfer equipment will travel such areas shall be hardsurfaced and the thickness and composition of such surfaces shall be shown on the plans barricades of a semipermanent nature affixed to the ground shall be placed to prevent vehicular travel on unsurfaced areas on the site  the location of such barricades shall be shown on the plan the haul road routes from the nearest city truck route shall be shown and identified on the plan such routes shall be reviewed by the engineering department who shall make recommendations thereon to the council such haul roads shall be chosen to avoid undue hardship to residents living adjacent to them and to minimize the likelihood of premature deterioration of city streets so chosen d unloading area all unloading compacting and transfer activities shall be conducted within a fully enclosed structure or structures each such structure shall be clearly depicted on the plan with dimensions in such fashion as to clearly show the type and location of equipment the proposed routing of unloading and transfer vehicles all vehicle entrance and exit facilities to and from such structure or structures and the waiting area for unloading vehicles which shall be sufficient to accommodate expected traffic such structures and waiting area shall be of sufficient size and appropriate design as will assure that the volume of vehicles expected on site at any one time can be accommodated without spillover on surrounding streets e drainage and sewers floor surfaces in each unloading compacting and transfer structure shall be so constructed that they can be cleaned by flushing and that they will permit the drainage of liquids without ponding  all such floor surfaces shall be equipped with floor drains or sump pump and with a trap or other mechanical device which shall prevent the passage of solids which system shall be connected to a sanitary sewer a storm drainage system for the site shall provide adequate storm drainage with minimum ponding and shall connect to a storm sewer all interior drainage lines from the unloading compacting and transfer areas as well as other drainage lines within the site shall be adequate to handle the volumes of water and liquids which may be expected all drainage and sewerage systems floor drains floor surfaces construction and locations of connections to sewers shall be clearly identified in the plan showing dimensions and composition where appropriate f sanitation and environmental control all solid waste shall be confined to unloading compacting and transfer structures and all solid waste remaining at the transfer station at the end of each day shall be stored in leakproof flyproof and rodentproof containers vector control principally rat abatement and mosquito abatement shall be the responsibility of the operator the transfer station site shall be kept in a suitable clean and sanitary condition at all times the application shall list the provisions at the site and the schedule for cleaning vehicles structures and grounds as well as the intended continuing vector control  sterling codifiers inc  251687 g fire prevention burning of solid waste either open or controlled is prohibited at the transfer station site if a fire hydrant is not located adjacent to the property and within three hundred feet 300 of the unloading compacting and transfer structure or structures then a fire hydrant shall be so installed and connected to an appropriate extension of the water main the location of the nearest fire hydrants to the transfer station shall be shown on the plan as shall such installations and extensions where applicable h equipment the transfer station shall be so designed and maintained that the operational failure of one component part will not result in a total shutdown of the operation an inventory of the equipment to be used in connection with the unloading compacting and transfer operation shall be contained in the application as well as a list of backup equipment available or failing direct availability the sources from which such equipment shall be obtained in the event of need i prohibited materials sewage solids or liquids and hazardous wastes shall not be unloaded or accepted at the transfer station solid waste material of such bulk as cannot be accommodated by direct transfer shall likewise be excluded from the transfer station j recycling if the operation of the transfer station includes isolation segregation and gathering of materials of a like or similar kind for salvage and reutilization by recycling the equipment methods and proposed operation in connection therewith shall be fully depicted and described in the application solid waste which is received at the transfer station site and which is not thereat separated for recycling may only be disposed of by hauling to a sanitary disposal project which has been approved by the appropriate governmental agency or agencies and is legally operating scavenging at the transfer station site shall be prohibited and all materials so separated and gathered for salvage and reutilization by recycling shall be retained in suitable containers as heretofore described until removed by appropriate vehicles to offsite destinations k personnel and hours the personnel planned to operate the site the times during which the gates will be open and the hours and days of the week during which the site will be open to receive solid waste shall be indicated in the application appropriate signs meeting the requirements of the zoning the district in which located shall be located at all entrance gates shall be lighted if appropriate shall identify such hours shall list prohibited materials and shall contain such further information as will assure conformance of visitors to the site to the requirements of this attendant shall be on duty at the site at all times when it is open for public use 1985  45b4 insurance the applicant shall file a certificate of insurance evidencing the issuance to the applicant of liability insurance which shall protect the public and any and all persons from denial the provisions of article a of this chapter for revocation or denial of renewal of a license for construction or demolition materials disposal sites shall apply to the license of a transfer station 1985  45b6 disposal of solid waste all persons operating a transfer station licensed under the provisions of this article shall deliver or cause to be delivered all solid waste coming within its control to the des moines metropolitan area solid waste agency disposal site or sites 1985  article c fees and charges 45c1 fees established the member municipality will fix establish and maintain and revise the same from time to time whenever necessary such rates fees rentals or other charges for the use and services of the disposal facilities operated by the agency as more fully described in the solid waste disposal service contract as will always provide in each year revenues sufficient to pay the proportionate share of such member municipality for a operation and maintenance expenses for said disposal facilities  b collection recycling billing and spring cleanup fees  c administrative fees  d the principal and interest on the solid waste disposal revenue bonds  and e all reserves its regular billing statement and collected in the same manner as water and sanitary sewer fees billing for the change in container size shall be made in the billing cycle following the change all charges imposed herein shall be due and payable upon receipt of the billing eff 912018 45c4 proration of charges the service availability charge shall be prorated according to the ratio of the number chapter is to promote recycling by requiring property owners to provide facilities for the source separation of recyclable materials at certain locations  462 definitions the following words and phrases when used in this chapter shall have unless the context clearly indicates otherwise the meanings given to them in this section city the city of west des moines collection the transportation of the municipal waste from the place it is generated and includes all activities up to the time the waste is delivered to a recycling facility or solid waste disposal site collector a person authorized by the city to collect transport and dispose of municipal waste or recyclable materials commingled source separated nonputrescible recyclable materials that have been mixed at the source of generation ie placed in the same container condominium an apartment building or housing area in which the dwelling units are owned individually designated recyclable material newspapers corrugated containers magazines catalogs junk mail kraft bags bimetal and ferrous cans aluminum cans clear glass containers high density polyethylene hdpe excluding motor oil bottles and polyethylene terephthalate pete whether alone or in combination dwelling unit a group of rooms located within a structure and forming a single habitable unit with facilities which are used or intended to be used for living sleeping cooking and eating for the exclusive use of the occupants thereof multifamily dwelling any building under one roof which contains two 2 or more complete dwelling units municipal waste any garbage refuse industrial lunchroom or office waste and other material including solid liquid semisolid or contained gaseous  sterling codifiers inc  254687 material resulting from the operation of multifamily dwellings nearby adjoining adjacent or contiguous nonrecyclable material any material not defined as recyclable material person any individual partnership corporation association institution cooperative enterprises or any other legal entity whatsoever which is recognized by law as being subject to such rights and duties premises real property on which any multifamily dwelling unit or combination of units sharing common driveways are located recycling the separation collection processing recovering and sale or reuse of materials which would otherwise be disposed of as municipal waste recycling facility any facility employing a technology that is a process that separates or recovers reusable materials that can be sold or reused by a manufacturer as substitute for or a supplement to virgin raw materials source separation the separation of recyclable materials from the municipal waste stream at the point of waste generation  463 establishment of recycling program a there is hereby established a recycling program for the source separation separate collection and recycling of designated recyclable materials generated within the city from all multifamily dwellings and dwelling units not presently served by existing residential recycling collection programs b collection of designated recyclable materials pursuant to this section shall be made at least twice per month or more often as necessary as determined by the director of public works or other designee of the city manager and the storage of said designated recyclable materials shall not result in the creation of a public nuisance c all multifamily dwellings which are not presently part of existing residential recycling collection programs shall be required to provide the facilities for the source separation of all designated recyclable materials generated on the premises and shall arrange for the collection of said materials to be transported to a recycling facility d program development implementation and operation shall be the responsibility of the same entity which contracts for the private collection and disposal of solid waste on the premises e the specific designated recyclable materials are those materials set out in section 462 of this chapter f the city reserves the right to amend the list of designated recyclable materials as defined in section 462 of this chapter at any time  464 reporting requirements it shall be the responsibility of all commercial waste haulers collecting solid waste or designated recyclable materials generated in the city to submit a recycling report to the city on an annual basis said report shall identify individual establishments being served and the total weight of recyclable materials collected as well as identification of the processor of each recovered recyclable material all such reports of the previous year shall be submitted on forms provided by the city to the director of public works or other designee of the city manager by january 31 the city reserves the right to require any additional information deemed necessary by the director of public works or other designee of the city manager  465 authorization of collectors all commercial solid waste haulers or haulers of designated recyclable materials who as a commercial enterprise provide the service of collection of said designated recyclable materials or waste to ownersoperators of multifamily dwelling units shall be duly authorized by the department of public works issuance of a license  466 license application term revocation rep by  467 applicability of regulations any person or persons engaged in the collection processing and marketing of designated recyclable materials within the city or who collects solid waste within the city and all householders firms corporations copartnerships and any and all persons who may or do produce solid waste andor designated recyclable materials shall be subject to the provisions of this chapter  468 collection and transportation of designated recyclable materials  sterling codifiers inc  255687 a transportation any person transporting designated recyclable materials within the city shall prevent or remedy any spillage from vehicles or containers used in the transport of such designated recyclable materials such vehicles or containers shall not be overfilled and shall be cleansed at sufficiently frequent intervals to prevent obnoxious odors or unhealthful conditions such vehicles shall also be so constructed loaded and driven so as to prevent any portion of the load from falling out upon the streets or highways b removal by collectors collectors shall return the recycling receptacles to the premises from which they have been removed in a manner so as not to create a public nuisance collectors shall also collect and remove all recyclable materials for which they are responsible to collect from the premises  469 storage of designated recyclable materials a general it shall be the duty of every owner or entity which contracts for the private collection and disposal of solid waste from the premises to provide and keep at all times a sufficient number of containers to hold all designated recyclable materials which may accumulate during the intervals between collection of such materials by the authorized collector containers may be located onsite or on nearby premises with the permission of the affected property owner or otherwise in accordance with the provision of this section owners of multifamily dwelling units shall insure that each dwelling unit has access to the containers and that said containers are sufficient to hold all designated recyclable materials accumulated by the occupants of the dwelling unit during the intervals between collections b storage all designated recyclable materials accumulated by owners andor occupants of multifamily dwelling units shall be placed in containers which are durable watertight and made of metal or plastic and marked with the recycling symbol or other acceptable markings the containers shall remain on the premises at all times and shall be kept in a clean condition the type of bulk container to be furnished by the collector shall be acceptable to the director of public works or other designee of the city manager containers shall have lids if necessary to avert a public nuisance or protect the marketing quality of designated recyclable materials such lids must remain closed except when designated recyclable materials are being placed in or removed from the container the container shall be clearly marked with both the recycling symbol and with the type of materials to be deposited in the container the container shall be kept clean and in good repair the number of such containers shall be sufficient to handle the volume of recyclables which accumulate between collection intervals c location of containers bulk storage containers for collection at multifamily dwellings using private collection shall be located on such premises at a place agreed upon by such owner or occupant of the property and the authorized collector such location shall not interfere with private or public sidewalks walkways driveways roads streets highways or entrances and exits of private or public buildings and shall be in compliance with all applicable laws bulk storage containers which are on wheels to facilitate their movement shall remain blocked at all times while unattended to prevent unintentional movement  4610 preparation of designated recyclable materials and placement for collection designated recyclable materials shall be separated and prepared in a manner consistent with recycling market requirements and placed at a designated area separate from municipal waste for collection at such time and dates as may be agreed upon between the collector and the establishment  a no person shall place drop commingle or deposit in recyclable material any solid waste or banned substance as defined in section 453 of this title into any designated recyclable material container bin or dumpster located on any premises any person who violates the provisions of this subsection shall upon conviction be subject to a fine of not to exceed one hundred dollars $10000 or imprisonment not to exceed thirty 30 days  4611 collection by unauthorized persons a it shall be a violation of this chapter for any persons unauthorized by the city to collect or pick up or cause to be collected or picked up any recyclable materials or solid waste each such collection in violation hereof shall constitute a separate and distinct offense and shall be subject to the following civil penalties 1 one hundred dollars $10000 for the first offense  2 five hundred dollars $50000 for the second offense  and 3 one thousand dollars $100000 for each subsequent offense b notwithstanding any provision of this chapter any person having ownership of the same may sell or donate recyclable materials for the purpose of recycling to any person partnership or corporation whether operating for profit or not for profit  4612 enforcement a administration the citys department of community development is hereby authorized and directed to administer and enforce this chapter at apartment complexes community development department personnel will tie recycling compliance into their biannual multifamily inspections and include it on the inspectors checklist enforcement relative to multifamily recycling may also be handled by more frequent inspections or on a complaint basis  b violation and penalty except as set forth in subsection 4610a of this chapter any person who shall fail neglect or refuse to comply with any terms or provisions of this chapter or any regulation or requirement pursuant thereto and authorized thereby shall be subject to a civil penalty of one dollar  sterling codifiers inc  256687 $100 per month for each dwelling unit on the premises in violation of this chapter  noise control 471 title a these regulations shall be officially known cited and referred to as the noise control regulations of the city of west des moines iowa hereinafter these regulations  472 policy a excessive noise is a serious hazard to the public health and welfare and the quality of life in a close urban society b a substantial body of science and technology exists by which excessive noise can be substantially abated without serious inconvenience to the public c certain noise producing equipment in this community is essential to the quality of life herein and should be allowed to continue at reasonable levels with moderate regulation d each person has the right to an environment reasonably free from noise which jeopardizes health welfare or which unduly interferes with a property owners right to the use or enjoyment of their property e it is recognized that residential land uses are more noise sensitive than commercial and industrial land uses and that commercial land uses are more noise sensitive than industrial land uses f it is the declared policy of this city to promote an environment free from excessive noise otherwise properly called noise pollution which unreasonably jeopardizes the health and welfare and degrades the quality of the lives of the residents of this community without unduly prohibiting limiting or otherwise regulating the function of certain noise producing equipment and events which is not amenable to such controls and yet is essential to the economy and quality of life of the community  473 purpose a these regulations are adopted for the following purposes 1 to address concerns expressed by citizens and businesses of this community 2 to establish standards for the control of noise pollution in the city by setting maximum permissible sound levels for various land uses 3 to protect and provide for the public health safety and general welfare of the city 4 this chapter shall apply to the control of noise originating within the limits of the city  474 definitions a for the purpose of this chapter certain terms or words used herein shall be interpreted as follows aweighted sound level the sound pressure level in decibels as measured on a sound level meter using the aweighted filter network adverse impact a state of facts as would lead a reasonable person of normal sensitivity acting prudently to conclude that the economic entertainment and philanthropic benefits to the community do not reasonably outweigh the quiet use and enjoyment of the affected property ambient level all encompassing sound at a given place usually a composite of sounds from many sources near and far amplified sound the production or reproduction of sound from amplification equipment background level ambient level sound less the noise disturbance cweighted sound level the sound pressure level in decibels as measured on a sound level meter using the cweighted filter network construction any site preparation assembly erection substantial repair alteration or similar action for or of public or private rights of way structures utilities or similar property dba decibels measured using an aweighted sound level dbc decibels measured using a cweighted sound level decibel db a unit for measuring the amplitude of a sound equal to twenty 20 times the logarithm to the base 10 of the ratio of the pressure of the sound measured to the reference pressure which is twenty 20 micropascals  sterling codifiers inc  257687 demolition any dismantling intentional destruction or removal of structures utilities public or private right of way surfaces or similar property emergency any occurrence or set of circumstances involving actual or imminent physical or psychological trauma or property damage which demands immediate action emergency work any work performed for the purpose of alleviating or resolving an emergency l5a the aweighted sound level exceeded five percent 5% of the ten 10 minute sound meter reading or more than thirty 30 seconds in total l5c the cweighted sound level exceeded five percent 5% of the ten 10 minute sound meter reading or more than thirty 30 seconds in total noise any sound which disturbs humans or which causes or tends to cause an adverse psychological or physiological effect on humans noise disturbance any sound which endangers or injures the welfare safety or health of a human being or disturbs a reasonable person of normal sensitivities or devalues or injures personal or real property noise sensitive land use those specific land uses which have associated indoor andor outdoor human activities that may be subject to stress andor significant interference from noise produced by community sound sources such human activity typically occurs daily for continuous periods of twenty four 24 hours or is in such a nature that noise is significantly disruptive to activities that occur for short periods specifically noise sensitive land uses include hospitals rest homes convalescent care facilities places of worship and schools person a natural person heirs executors administrators or assigns and also includes a firm partnership or corporation its or their successors or assigns or the agent of any of the aforesaid plainly audible any noise or sound for which the information content of the noise or sound is transferred to the listener such as but not limited to understanding of spoken speech comprehension of whether a voice is raised or lowered or comprehension of musical rhythms public right of way any street avenue boulevard highway sidewalk alley or similar place which is owned or controlled by a governmental entity public space any real property including any structure thereon which is owned or controlled by a governmental entity receiving land use the use or occupancy of the property which receives the transmission of sound as hereinafter defined sound an oscillation in pressure particle displacement particle velocity or other physical parameter in a medium with internal forces that cause compression and rarefaction of that medium the description of sound may include any characteristic of such sound including duration intensity and frequency sound amplifying equipment any machine or device for the amplification of the human voice music or any other sound sound equipment any radio record player stereo television compact disc player tape deck or player loudspeakers amplifier sound truck or other device for producing reproducing or amplifying sounds sound level noise level the weighted sound pressure level obtained by use of a sound level meter having a standard frequency filter for attenuating part of the sound spectrum sound level meter an instrument including a microphone an amplifier an output meter and frequency weighting networks for the measurement and determination of noise and sound levels  475 measurement of noise and sound the measurement of noise or sound shall be made with a sound level meter meeting the standards prescribed by the american national standards institute  476 test measurement and requirements for determination and classification of sound a for the purposes of determining and classifying any sound as excessive or unusually loud the following test measurement and requirements are to be applied 1 the sound must be measured at or within the property boundary of the receiving land use 2 unamplified sound shall be measured on a sound level meter of standard design and quality operated in a slow response weighing scale 3 amplified sound shall be measured on a sound level meter of standard design and quality operated in c slow response weighing scale 4 a sound measured or registered in excess of the maximum permitted levels is prohibited 5 a ten 10 minute l5a or l5c ambient level measurement must be taken to determine whether the sound disturbance exceeds the maximum permissible level allowed for a receiving land use a one minute l5a or l5c background level measurement should also be taken when the sound disturbance is inactive the ambient level measurement must be a minimum of ten 10 db above the background level measurement to attribute the noise to the sound disturbance the one minute l5a or l5c background level measurement shall be deemed to be the background level measurement that existed at the time of the ambient level measurement the person responsible for the sound disturbance must render the noise inactive for the purposes of a one minute background level measurement within thirty 30 minutes of a request to do so by a police officer or other city official authorized to enforce the provisions of this chapter if the person responsible fails to timely render the noise inactive for the one minute background level measurement that person thereby waives the ten 10 db difference requirement and the result of the ten 10 minute ambient level measurement shall be deemed to be the noise attributed to the sound disturbance   sterling codifiers inc  258687 477 maximum permissible sound levels by receiving land use a with the exception of sound levels elsewhere specifically authorized or allowed in this chapter the following are maximum permissible sound levels allowed at or within the property boundary of a receiving land use for unamplified sound receiving land use maximum l5a level permitted 7 am  7 pm 7 pm  10 pm 10 pm  7 am residential 65 dba 60 dba 55 dba commercial 65 dba 65 dba 65 dba industrial 80 dba 80 dba 80 dba noise sensitive 65 dba 60 dba 55 dba b with the exception of sound levels elsewhere specifically authorized or allowed in this chapter the following are maximum permissible sound levels allowed at or within the property boundary of a receiving land use for amplified sound receiving land use maximum l5c level permitted 7 am  7 pm 7 pm  10 pm 10 pm  7 am residential 76 dbc 74 dbc 72 dbc commercial 82 dbc 80 dbc 78 dbc industrial 85 dbc 85 dbc 85 dbc noise sensitive 76 dbc 74 dbc 72 dbc c if the volume of sound exceeds the maximum permissible sound level by a measurement of l5a or l5c at any time during a ten 10 minute meter reading the sound is prohibited and is in violation of this chapter  478 exceptions to this chapter a the maximum permissible sound levels of this chapter shall not apply to 1 the emission of sound made by safety signals warning devices and sound resulting from any authorized emergency vehicle when responding to an emergency call or acting in time of an emergency an authorized emergency vehicle shall include local state and federal law enforcement vehicles emergency medical vehicles and fire department vehicles 2 noncommercial public speaking and public assembly activities conducted on any public space or public right of way during the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 3 the emission of sound unamplified human voice 4 agricultural activities associated with the raising and harvesting of crops exclusive of those involving the ownership or possession of animals or birds 5 rail and air transportation and public mass transportation vehicles 6 the emission of sound in the performance of military operations exclusive of travel by individuals to or from military duty 7 the emission of sound from activities in the discharge of weapons fireworks displays parades concerts or other events expressly permitted or authorized by the city council this exception includes outdoor historic valley junction foundation events as long as such events conclude by eight thirty oclock  pm the outdoor historic valley junction foundation events may be permitted to extend past eight thirty oclock  pm but are subject to city approval and the maximum permissible sound levels prescribed within this chapter 8 the emission of sound from activities where a state or federal agency has adopted a different standard or rules than that prescribed within this chapter 9 the emission of sound during nonprofessional athletic and school events or practices 10 the emission of sound during demolition work construction work for which a building permit grading permit or demolition permit is required or a development plan approved in cases where the sound originates within three hundred feet 300 of a residential land use or noise sensitive land use the exemption shall only apply between the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 11 the emission of sound from the use of lawn and garden equipment and chain saws in cases where the sound originates within three hundred feet 300 of a residential land use or noise sensitive land use the exemption shall only apply between the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 12 the emission of sound from the use of snow removal equipment  sterling codifiers inc  259687 13 the emission of sound from on site stationary trash compactors in cases where the sound originates within three hundred feet 300 of a residential land use or noise sensitive land use the exemption shall only apply between the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 14 the emission of sound from municipal or municipally contracted compactor trucks loading or unloading of yard waste recyclable material trash and garbage 15 the operation of private compactor trucks in the loading and unloading of yard waste recyclable material trash and garbage on private property in cases where the sound originates within three hundred feet 300 of a residential land use or noise sensitive land use the exemption shall only apply between the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 16 the emission of sound during the operation maintenance repair and cleaning of public streets and facilities 17 the emission of sound during public and private parking lot maintenance and repair in cases where the sound originates within three hundred feet 300 of a residential land use or noise sensitive land use the exemption shall only apply between the hours of seven oclock  am to ten oclock  pm 18 work performed by or for public utilities 19 live radio broadcasts as long as such broadcasts utilize fifty 50 watts or less of electrical power as provided in subsection 4711j of this chapter b although exempt from the maximum permissible sound levels of this chapter a sound equipment permit is required in all cases where sound equipment and sound amplifying equipment will be used unless explicitly exempted within this chapter eff 112015 479 vehicle noise limits no person shall operate or control a motor vehicle which is moving or stationary standing or parked whether or not persons are seated in the motor vehicle from which any amplified sound is plainly audible at a distance of fifty feet 50 from the vehicle between the hours of seven oclock  am and ten oclock  pm or is plainly audible at a distance of twenty five feet 25 from the vehicle between the hours of ten oclock  pm and seven oclock  am  4710 general prohibition a no person shall engage or participate in activities which result in noise levels which exceed the maximum permitted noise levels outlined in section 47 7 of this chapter b it shall be the duty of the owner to prevent such premises or vehicles from being the site of such activities producing sound levels in excess of what is permitted under this chapter failure or refusal to perform such duty shall constitute a violation of this section the owner may include one or more of the following fee title owner lessee and other persons granted a legal right to exercise use of the property c it shall be the duty of persons in positions of leadership or responsibility with respect to unincorporated associations groups gatherings or assemblages of people to prevent such from causing or making sound levels in excess of what is permitted under this chapter  4711 regulation of sound equipment and sound amplifying equipment a no person shall use or cause to be used any loudspeaker loudspeaker system sound amplifier or any other machine or device which produces reproduces or amplifies sound outside of buildings or other enclosed structures for the purpose of amplifying a live performance or prerecorded music without first obtaining a permit to do so b a permit may be obtained by making application to the city clerk or designee c application requests shall be filed with the city clerk no application request shall be accepted for filing and processing unless it conforms to the requirements of this chapter contains in a full true and correct form the required materials and information prescribed by the forms supplied by the city clerk and is accompanied by the appropriate fees d all permits are subject to approval by the city clerk or designee the city clerk shall have the discretion to refer any sound permit request to the city council for their review and action the city council must approve any sound permit request that extends past ten oclock  pm before the city decides to approve a sound permit request the city may require the applicant to provide notice in a form and manner approved by the city clerk of the proposed event to all neighboring residential property owners located within three hundred seventy feet 370 of the subject property e the permit requires separate payment for each type of activity and permits shall be nontransferable a permit for a single event or a series of events at the same location may be issued the city council the city clerk or designee retains the ability to revoke or modify any issued permits for any alleged violations of this chapter including those based upon sound meter readings taken by the city the chief of police or designee may also terminate the permit activity if the activity continues to exceed the maximum permitted sound level after the permit holder or the holders employee or agent has been advised that the activity has exceeded the maximum permitted sound level f the permit shall be displayed on or immediately adjacent to the sound equipment g each application request shall be accompanied by the fee specified by city council resolution before it is accepted for filing and processing  sterling codifiers inc  260687 h if the property is a rental property the applicant needs to have written permission from the landlord if the property is under common ownership the applicant needs to have written permission from the landlord or association i the use of any loudspeaker loudspeaker system sound amplifier or any other similar machine or device which is permitted pursuant to this section is subject to the following regulations 1 the only sound permitted shall be either music or human speech or both 2 the volume of the sound amplified pursuant to this section shall not exceed the maximum permissive sound levels measured from the receiving land use as outlined in this chapter j any radio record player stereo television compact disc player tape deck or player including any associated speakers that is rated for fifty 50 watts or less of electrical power does not require a sound permit application eff 112015 4712 conditions of sound permit approval a the city clerk or designee may regulate the issuance of a surrounding area 2 prior violations of this chapter by the applicant requesting a sound permit  4714 appeals wherein the applicant the adjacent property owner or any officer department board or bureau of the city is affected by any decision or order made by the city clerk or designee regarding the approval or denial of a sound permit such appeal shall be taken within ten 10 calendar days from the
