operated at a no wake speed on raccoon river park lake except for in areas designated as nonmotorized and electric motors only zones all other regulations under the code of iowa chapter 462a shall apply all sailboats with a mast height measuring thirty six feet 36 or greater above from the water surface are prohibited on the raccoon river park lake additionally all sailboats are prohibited on raccoon river park lake when the lake water level reaches an elevation of one foot 1 above the concrete dock at the boat ramp  aa fishing fishing activities in parks shall comply with the code of iowa chapter 481a bb sales in parks no sales activities or admissions shall be allowed in any park except with approval of the director of parks and recreation cc hunting it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in any hunting activity on park property using a rifle shotgun bow and arrow or any other means on land or in the water unless approved by official action of the park and recreation advisory board and the city council dd trapping  exceptions it shall be unlawful for any person to place locate set use or attempt to use on park property any type of claw spring or metal trap of any nature on land or in the water or to set use or maintain any snare pitfall deadfall spring gun set gun or device of similar character or purpose exceptions the city or its authorized agents are exempt from the above and may control or manage animals birds or insects pursuant to established policies that have been approved by the city council ee camping all overnight camping is prohibited unless written authorization is received from the director of parks and recreation  7113 penalty violations of this chapter are declared to be municipal infractions and may be punished as provided in title 1 chapter 4 of this code for violations of subsections 7112i use of tobacco 7112s consumption in public parks and 7112x swimmingbeach use of this chapter police officers or designees shall enforce and be authorized to issue citationcomplaints before issuing a citationcomplaint the police officer or designee shall verify that the offender has previously received a warning against engaging in such conduct or the offender has refused to discontinue engaging in such conduct after the police officer or designee has advised the offender that such conduct must cease a one hundred dollar $10000 civil penalty shall be imposed for each violation where a citationcomplaint has been issued for violations of subsection 7112c parking of this chapter police officers or designees shall be authorized to issue parking tickets as specified in title 6 motor vehicles and traffic of this code  library regulations 7121 purpose the purpose of this chapter is to adopt certain library rules governing the conduct of patrons of the library of the city the term library as used herein refers to the city library building located at 4000 mills civic parkway west des moines iowa   sterling codifiers inc  411687 7122 rules and regulations the following rules and regulations are established concerning the conduct of patrons and use of library facilities as follows a library patrons are expected to be engaged in the productive use of the librarys resources this includes reading studying researching attending programs and utilizing library material patrons have the right to use the library undisturbed and library employees have the right to work without undue interference b the library will not tolerate bullying in any library space gathering or program and staff will do all they reasonably can to create a safe space for all library users regardless of an individuals actual or perceived age color creeddenomination national origin race religion marital status sex sexual orientation gender identity physical attributesappearance physical or mental ability or disability ancestry political party preference political belief socioeconomic status or familial status bullying is defined as the unwanted aggressive use of physical social or mentalintellectual power to control harm or humiliate another person in a repetitive or pervasive manner c no person shall engage in any conduct which disturbs or interferes with the legitimate use of the library as follows 1 refuse to follow reasonable directives or instructions from a library staff member 2 willfully annoy bully harass or threaten another person 3 behave in a disorderly loud or boisterous manner including loud conversations 4 interfere with another persons passage within the library or on library grounds 5 consume or possess alcoholic beverages unless the library board of trustees has approved of an event or function at the library where alcoholic beverages will be provided the consumption or possession of alcoholic beverages shall be limited to that provided to those in attendance at the approved library event or function and shall be confined to a designated area within the library during the event or function 6 use or possess controlled substances on library grounds or be under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances in a manner that causes public disturbance 7 possess any firearm knife or any device which could be used as a weapon or other weapon prohibited by city ordinance or state statutes 8 deface or destroy library property 9 eat or drink in the library unless eating or drinking is specifically allowed in an area or at a particular activity 10 use tobacco or smoke in the library including the use of electronic cigarettes or vaping devices 11 sleep in the library or exhibit the appearance of sleep 12 remain in the library after regular closing hours 13 solicit funds panhandle or engage in commercial activity unless authorized by library administration 14 interfere with patrons use of the library bodily hygiene which is so offensive as to constitute a nuisance or use of perfume cologne or alcohol 15 bring animals into the library except as required by persons with disabilities 16 use sports equipment skates or a skateboard in the library 17 use any audio personal communication or computing device in a manner that is disturbing to other patrons cellphone ringers should be set to silent or vibrate and device speakers muted or headphones used 18 campaign leaflet petition interview or survey patrons or staff in a manner that is disruptive to library activities 19 willfully expose patrons and staff to offensive images or language 20 engage in lengthy conversations including conversations on cellphones in areas intended for quiet study 21 interfere with the librarys right to maintain a clean pleasant and safe facility 22 relocate or rearrange furniture beyond repositioning existing seating around tables 23 be in any state of inappropriate undress 24 engage in sexual activity of any kind including inappropriate displays of romantic affection 25 bring luggage bedrolls or large bags into the library 26 leave packages backpacks or personal belongings unattended personal property must be within sight of the owner the library assumes no responsibility for belongings left unattended large or possibly valuable belongings left on the premises after closing will be forwarded to the police department 27 use bathrooms for unreasonable or unintended purposes such as bathing or laundering  7123 violation  penalty  sterling codifiers inc  412687 any person who violates the provisions of this chapter upon conviction shall be punished not in excess of a one hundred dollar $10000 fine or in excess of thirty 30 days imprisonment  special assessments for streets 7131 purpose a the purpose of this to provide general guidance to staff and notice to citizens concerning the processes utilized to establish special assessments for street improvements which will be levied upon private property in west des moines whenever the word assessment or words special assessment are used in this the word or words refer only to special assessments for street improvement projects including construction paving reconstruction resurfacing or repair measures b it is realized that special situations will arise which cannot be anticipated in a general policy but which will need to be addressed in a reasonable manner once they arise while this be literally applied to every such exceptional situation it is nonetheless the directive of the city council that the concepts reflected in this fairly and equitably applied in a reasonable fashion to all street assessments  7132 scope a policy it is the policy of the city to eventually have all streets within the city paved or widened to the extent suitable to their intended or actual use all street improvement projects shall be assessed in accord with this as limited by the purpose to the extent such improvement benefits property in a definable benefited property district or area b other finance mechanisms the city council recognizes that not all streets are improved of a special assessment and that developers and others may finance the improvement of streets use of other mechanisms where such alternative mechanisms have effectively shifted costs to benefited property owners even when not formally assessed such property owners shall be treated as if their property had been previously assessed the city will not ordinarily place the same tract of land in more than one benefited property district for assessment purposes c street width  special benefit the amount assessed for any street improvement project shall normally be equivalent to constructing paving repairing or widening a local street in accordance with the current urban design policy standards manual and the urban specifications for construction of public improvements the design standards as adopted or amended by the city in so limiting the amount of assessment it is the intent of the council to assess only for the special benefit derived from a street improvement project  provided however that the city council may in its discretion assess up to the width of the classification of the street being improved as provided in the design standards d general benefits all general benefits from a street improvement project in excess of the above standard shall be paid from other city funds and shall not be assessed subject to final determination by the council the percentage of general benefit to the city shall be determined in accordance with the schedule set forth in subsection 7133f of this assessable items assessable items to the extent special benefits are conferred shall include 1 all related storm sewer for the project but not all storm sewer costs and oversizing of drains necessitated by anticipated future expansion shall be assessed 2 all required grading for the project 3 all utility relocations required due to the project 4 all driveways sidewalks and trails required due to the project 5 all surface restoration required by the project 6 all right of way required due to the project up to sixty feet 60 7 all the engineering fees associated with the design and construction of the project 8 all legal fees associated with the project 9 all appraisal fees associated with the project 10 pro rata share of administrative costs 11 paving costs 12 traffic signals where a special local benefit is conferred 13 all other miscellaneous costs and contingency costs directly related to the project f design standards all standards and details of design for proposed assessment projects shall be in accordance with the design standards as amended and the comprehensive plan as amended  sterling codifiers inc  413687 g street improvements in addition to constructing new streets the city may assess for street widening reconstruction repair or resurfacing when such improvement is found to confer special benefits such assessment will ordinarily occur only in a manner consistent with this general statement and only to the extent that the property has not been assessed or owners have not otherwise previously participated directly in the cost of such construction  7133 procedure a procedural steps the city will generally endeavor to follow the procedural steps set out in this identification of streets city staff shall during the budget process or as part of the citizens capital improvement program and at other times as directed by the city council identify streets which in the opinion of staff should be considered for improvement the city manager shall review such recommendations and report to the mayor and city council his or her findings as to the need for improvement the city council shall act upon such recommendations as part of its annual budgetary process either of capital improvement projects or at such times as may seem proper in the circumstances c petition by property owners as an alternative assessments for street improvement projects may be initiated by petition of all property owners to be assessed for the cost subject to council approval such projects however shall normally be considered in light of the regular budgetary process d project determination after the initial considerations and discussions set forth above the city council shall decide whether it wishes to consider a street improvement project and whether that project should be specially assessed as part of such decision the city council shall direct the appropriate eminent domain notice be issued and may employ consulting engineers bond counsel and such other consultants as may be necessary e preliminary plat and schedule of assessments as part of the consideration of whether to levy special assessment for a project the city council shall direct the engineer to prepare a preliminary plat and schedule of assessments estimate the costs and preliminary plans and specifications and to furnish necessary data to bond counsel needed to prepare legal proceedings the engineer shall present a preliminary draft of the plat and schedule to the city staff which shall review the documents and make recommendations to the city council f arterial or collector streets all streets classified in the then current comprehensive plan as arterial or collector shall be considered to generally benefit the community as well as specially benefited properties in the benefited property district therefore any reduction in the special assessment shall generally be applied to the specially affected parcel within one hundred fifty feet 150 of the street improvement project in accordance with the following schedule street classification amount of reduction major arterial 40 percent minor arterial 20 percent major collector 10 percent minor collector 5 percent the distance of one hundred fifty feet 150 on each side of the street shall generally be applied to create an area similar to the area established by application of the flint formula as further set forth in of this final determination of any reduction however shall be established by the city council g property valuation the city council shall determine the valuation of the property to be specially assessed the valuations for property within the proposed assessment district shall not exceed the fair market value of the property with the proposed public improvement in place the city council shall retain the services of an mai appraiser to advise the city council as to its findings regarding the valuation of each lot and parcel within the benefited property district with the street improvement in place h project information meeting as part of the consideration of whether to levy a special assessment for a street improvement project the city council shall either conduct a project information meeting or direct staff to conduct a project information meeting benefited property owners shall be notified by letter with details concerning the proposed project and the time location and place of the meeting staff shall arrange for the delivery of the notification at least ten 10 days prior to the meeting i informational pamphlet staff shall provide an informational pamphlet describing the project assessment procedure and pertinent deadlines along with a copy of this those attending the project information meeting and to others upon request no official action shall be taken by the city council on the assessment proceeding within a thirty 30 day period following the project information meeting to permit affected property owners to petition for or against the project j preliminary plans and specifications at the completion of the above process the preliminary plans and specifications preliminary plat schedule of assessments and estimate of costs shall be officially filed in the office of the city clerk k council resolutions after the filing of the preliminary plans and specifications preliminary plat schedule of assessments and estimate of costs the city council shall meet to consider the preliminary resolution for the street improvement project resolution fixing value of lots resolution adopting preliminary plat and schedule estimate of costs and preliminary plans and specifications if the city council adopts the foregoing it shall then consider a proposed resolution of necessity for the project and set a date and time for public hearing on the proposed resolution of necessity  sterling codifiers inc  414687 l notice to property owners  publication notice shall then be given to the affected property owners that the proposed resolution of necessity will be considered by the city council the notice shall be published as required by law m resolution of necessity the city council shall hold a public hearing on the resolution of necessity the city council shall hear all objections and endorsements and consider all filed and written objections the city council shall then officially continue or close the public hearing after closing the public hearing the city council may reject adopt or amend and adopt the proposed resolution of necessity or the city council may defer action until a subsequent meeting n required vote passage of the resolution of necessity shall require the affirmative vote of threequarters 34 of the city council  provided however if written remonstrances signed by the owners of seventy five percent 75% of the amount of the proposed assessments on property subject to assessment have been timely filed with the city clerk the resolution of necessity will require the unanimous affirmative vote of the city council for passage o plans and specifications  contract if the resolution of necessity is adopted either as proposed or as amended the city council shall then adopt resolutions directing the preparation of detailed plans and specifications and the form of contract and notice to bidders p court decree following the adoption of either the original or amended resolution of necessity when more than sixty percent 60% of the amount of the proposed assessments on property subject to assessment have petitioned against the project the city council may direct bond counsel or other legal counsel to file in district court a petition requesting the court to review and confirm the proposed street improvement by decree the city council at its own discretion retains the option of having other assessments for street projects confirmed by the same process q detailed plans and specifications detailed plans and specifications and the form of contract and notice to bidders shall officially be placed on file in the city clerks office r resolution ordering bids  approving plans the city council shall either at the meeting at which the resolution of necessity is adopted or thereafter adopt a resolution ordering bids approving plans specifications and form of contract and notice to bidder  fixing amount of bid security  ordering city clerk to publish notice fix a date for reviewing bids  and for a public hearing on plans specifications form of contract and estimate of costs the notice to bidder shall then be published as required by law s filing with county treasurer the resolution of necessity and preliminary plat and schedule of assessments shall be filed in the county treasurers office as required by state law the city clerk shall also execute a certificate with regard to the amount of agricultural deferment requests timely filed by property owners pursuant to of this public hearing  resolution awarding contract the city council shall hold a public hearing on the plans specifications and form of contract as required by the published notice after the public hearing is complete the council may adopt the resolution adopting plans specifications form of contract and estimated cost bids which have been received for the street improvement project shall be evaluated by city staff and where appropriate consulting engineers and legal counsel if satisfactory bids have been received the city council may adopt a resolution awarding a contract or the city council may defer action or for proper reasons reject all bids u review of completed work after completion or substantial completion and in accordance with law the engineer shall review the completed work and file certificates of completion and final estimates of costs with the city clerk the total project cost and the total assessable cost of the project shall be summarized by category with a full description of costs including unit quantities available to the public on request v resolution accepting work  levy of final assessments the city council shall then adopt a resolution accepting the work and ordering preparation of the final plat and schedule of assessments the final plat and schedule of assessment shall be filed by the engineer in the city clerks office the resolution adopting and levying the final assessments and providing for the payment thereof shall then be adopted by the city council in no case may the final assessments be greater than the preliminary assessment notice of filing of the final plat and schedule shall be given as required by law w final plat and schedule filed with county treasurer  notice to property owner the city clerk shall file a certificate of levy and copy of the final plat and schedule in the office of the county treasurer and the building permit officials office notice of such filing shall be published for two 2 consecutive weeks with the first publication not more than fifteen 15 days from the date of filing the final plat and schedule with the county officials on or before the date of the second publication of notice the clerk shall send by ordinary and certified mail a copy of the notice to each property owner  7134 payment of assessments a any assessment levied under this be paid in full or in part without interest within thirty 30 days after the date of certification b except as to assessments of less than one hundred dollars $10000 which must be paid in full before the next july 1 assessments may be paid with interest in installments with real estate taxes over a period of ten 10 years  7135 agricultural deferment a persons having a tract of land either alone or as an integral part of a larger tract which is both used and assessed for agricultural purposes and which would otherwise be subject to assessment may apply for an agricultural deferment as provided by state law  sterling codifiers inc  415687 b any property owner who seeks deferment of an assessment shall file a written request for deferment with the city clerk at the time of the hearing on the resolution of necessity or within ten 10 days following the date of the closing of the public hearing the request shall identify those lots subject to the proposed assessment which the property owner claims are entitled to agricultural deferment c it shall be the responsibility of the property owner to make such additional annual filings as are required by law for the continuation of an agricultural deferment  7136 deficiency assessments a if the proposed assessment is greater than twenty five percent 25% of the value of any tract with the improvement in place the council shall provide by resolution that the portion of the assessment which exceeds twenty five percent 25% of the value of the tract with the improvement in place shall be certified to the county treasurer as a deficiency b the amount of the deficiency shall amortize over a period of ten 10 years and after ten 10 years no part of the deficiency may be assessed  provided however that if a private improvement is constructed on a lot subject to deficiency during the period of amortization the prorata deficiency on the lot which has not been amortized shall be assessed to the extent that it is assessable  7137 assessment methods a the city council has elected to use formulas as a guide to the exercise of its legislative power to determine the proper amount to be assessed against property which receives a special benefit from a street improvement project depending upon the character of the street to be improved the city will utilize a method of assessment which assures that the assessable costs of a street improvement project are fairly spread among benefited properties and that no property is assessed an amount greater than the special benefit received b in its sole legislative discretion the city council shall determine whether the application and use of a formula to guide it in establishing the amount of individual assessments meet the criteria established by this the law  7138 benefits a benefit conferred it is the policy of the city not to assess any amount for street improvements in excess of the benefit conferred on a lot or parcel benefits resulting from street improvements which inure to property owners within the assessment area will depend upon the circumstances of each project b nature and extent of benefits as a result of street improvement projects property owners often benefit from enhanced access an improved environment because of dust and drainage control enhancement of aesthetic qualities in the area a decrease in the cost of automobile and other vehicle maintenance an improvement in the ability of police fire ambulance and other public safety organizations to respond an increase in the value of property and an improvement in the ability of property owners to market their property either for present uses or possibly new uses moreover the nature and extent of benefits may vary depending upon conditions in the area of the improvement including such factors as topography the level of economic activity and the level or nature of economic development c not exhaustive discussion any discussion in this specific special benefits is not to be construed as exhaustive or illustrative of all benefits which may in any particular project inure to the benefit of property owners  and this neither intended to be nor to be construed as a complete or definitive discussion of the special benefits to be derived from street improvement projects  7139 modified flint formula a in areas of the city laid out in a traditional grid or similar pattern a modified flint formula shall be used to determine assessments streets to be assessed by this method shall be largely those commonly known as infill streets all property within three hundred feet 300 of the right of way or onehalf 12 the distance to the next parallel street whichever distance is less shall be assessed benefit calculated upon a curve which applies incrementally less benefit to parcels of property located a greater distance from the proposed improvements b a depth factor chart and proximity curve as adopted by the city council and on file with the city clerks office shall be used in calculating assessments levied under this method the curve may however be modified by the city council for any street improvement project where reason or circumstances require such modification moreover the council may modify any proposed assessment which results from the application of the curve where reason or circumstances make such modification reasonable or just all modifications however shall be limited to the extent necessary to reflect actual special benefit conferred on the lot or parcel  71310 area district assessment method a the area district assessment method shall be used for the assessment of all streets which confer local benefit outside the traditional grid pattern as set forth in of this is the intent of the council that all property served outside the traditional grid pattern be assessed for the street improvement which provides access and other special benefits in accord with city street and development plans but that no parcel shall generally be assessed more than once for such improved street b the area district assessment method may be combined with any other method of assessment if the council finds such combination is necessary in order to properly determine special benefits in an area   sterling codifiers inc  416687 71311 boundaries of assessment districts for area district assessment a the boundaries of an area to be assessed in an area district assessment shall be established in accord with this shall include the benefited land on both sides of the street to be improved the line demarcating the boundaries shall commence at the intersecting streets at the terminus of the street improvements and bisect the land area to be served by the public improvement and the intersecting streets so as to divide the service area of the streets where actual bisection is inappropriate because of street patterns land divisions natural or other barriers adjustments will be made to accommodate such patterns barriers or divisions the assessment district shall be established based upon the area served or otherwise benefited by the street improvement b in determining actual boundaries all property which reasonably receives a special benefit shall be included in the district to establish district boundaries consideration shall be given to topography land division lines planning and development criteria regarding land use in the district actual and present land use the need to plan for and provide access to adjacent areas the need to coordinate access to adjacent areas plans for the use and the actual use of adjacent areas actual and projected street and transportation patterns and the relationship of the street improvement project to other planned projected or existing public improvements where possible all land within one subdivision should be included within a single area assessment district in establishing boundaries all lots on a street which provide access to the street being improved should be included in the same district c the city council shall make the final determination of the boundaries of the district after holding a public hearing pursuant to subsection 7133m of this giving consideration to the provisions of this the advice and judgment of engineers and other consultants and such other considerations as it deems appropriate to its determination  71312 methodology a special benefit conferred in the application of the area assessment method the city shall generally follow the method set out below reserving however to the city council the right to vary amend or otherwise change the formula or method or the application of either where such modification is necessary in order to properly reflect in the assessment the special benefit conferred by a street improvement project b area distribution after the benefited area has been preliminarily determined the assessment shall be distributed over the entire area based upon the area of each lot included in the district the resulting calculation shall constitute the base assessment rate for the public improvement project for purposes of assessment a lot shall be defined consistent with the definition in iowa 1999 as an actual platted lot or any other tract of land under common ownership c direct access an area of depth up to one hundred fifty feet 150 which have or could reasonably have direct vehicular access by driveway or otherwise onto the public improvement shall be assessed at a rate of two 2 times the base assessment rate in the area any portion of a lot with direct access within an area of depth greater than one hundred fifty feet 150 shall be assessed at the base assessment rate d abutting abutting lots shall be defined consistent with the definition in iowa 1999 as lots which abut or join the street in which the public improvement is located or which abut the right of way of the public improvement an area of depth up to one hundred fifty feet 150 which abut the public improvement but which lack direct access by driveway or otherwise shall be assessed at a rate of one and onehalf 112 times the base assessment to reflect the special benefit of proximity to the street improvement project any portion of abutting lots within an area of depth greater than one hundred fifty feet 150 shall be assessed at the base assessment rate e adjacent adjacent lots shall be defined consistent with the definition of iowa 1999 as lots within the district which do not abut upon the street or right of way of the public improvement adjacent lots within an area of depth up to one hundred fifty feet 150 shall be assessed at a rate of one and onehalf 112 times the base assessment rate to reflect the special benefit of proximity to the street improvement project any portion of adjacent lots within an area of depth greater than one hundred fifty feet 150 shall be assessed at the base assessment rate in the area f subdivided   preliminary plat  development agreement parcels which abut the street improvement but have not been subdivided into residential lots at the time of the preliminary schedule of assessments even though such lots could be divided into residential lots shall be considered to have direct access to the public improvement and shall be assessed to a depth of one hundred fifty feet 150 at a rate of two 2 times the base rate of assessment in the area  provided however that if a preliminary plat is filed and approved or a development agreement is executed with the city prior to the passage of the resolution of necessity the lots shown by such plat or agreement shall be used to determine the rate of assessment any development agreement executed pursuant to this subsection shall be recorded g city council final determination the city council shall make the final determination by reviewing the formula results and may adjust the formula or the results as to the entire area individual lots or both in order to achieve a fair and just distribution of any assessment in accord with the special benefit conferred by the improvement project to lots in the assessment district  utility systems 7141 subject to city approval a all installation replacement or upgrade of cables wires and conduits in connection with any utility system shall require submission of detailed plans to the city of detailed plans clearly indicating proposed work and all applicable city permits shall be approved by the city before proposed utility work commences  sterling codifiers inc  417687 b all utility work shall comply with the citys current design standards and standard construction specifications eff 182001 7142 placement underground a underground all cables wires and conduits in connection with any utility system shall be placed underground except as provided in subsection b of this section b exceptions underground installation shall not be required in the following situations 1 electric lines of nominal voltage in excess of fifteen thousand 15000 volts 2 where aboveground connection to building or other location is reasonably necessary as determined by the public works director 3 where another section of this code specifically allows aboveground placement 4 replacement or upgrade of aboveground cables and wires where the length of replacement or upgrade does not exceed three hundred feet 300 5 electric transformers telephone and cable tv pedestals and any other appurtenances in connection with any utility system as approved by the public works director 6 replacement of support poles for aboveground cables when the segment of pole replacement does not exceed three hundred feet 300 7 when the public works director deems an exception to be in the best interest of the city c upgrade and replacement of existing systems the provisions of subsection a of this section shall apply to any system upgrade including replacement or relocation of existing utility cables wires or conduits d all parts of city the application of this chapter shall apply to all areas of the city and shall not be limited to public ways property and easements eff 182001 7143 placement aboveground a structures within city street right of way 1 structures associated with any cables wires or conduits in connection with any utility system shall not be placed within the street clear zone as defined in the citys current design standards and standard construction specifications except as directed by city council should after city council approval said structures be placed within the street clear zone as defined herein it will be the responsibility of the utility company to provide at no cost to the city all barricades safety measures etc as deemed necessary by the public works director for any structure in connection with any utility system that is placed within the said street clear zone defined herein 2 all aboveground structures associated with any cables wires or conduits in connection with any utility system shall be maintained by the respective utility so as to be plumb secured to prevent unauthorized entrance and finished where appropriate to be aesthetically attractive  eff 182001 7144 violation any person who violates the provisions of this chapter upon conviction shall be subject to civil penalty of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 for each violation or if the infraction is a repeat offense a civil penalty not to exceed seven hundred fifty dollars $75000 for each repeat offense eff 182001 public arts 7151 purpose  policy a the purposes of this chapter are to promote the cultural heritage and artistic development of the city to enhance the citys character and identity to contribute to economic development and tourism to add warmth dignity beauty and accessibility to public spaces and to expand the experience and participation of citizens with visual arts by directing the inclusion of public arts in appropriate city capital improvement program projects b the city council recognizes the importance of the creation support and maintenance of public arts the city council shall fund the public arts program with a portion of hotelmotel funds as determined annually in the adoption of the final budget the funds shall be used for artist design services and for the selection acquisition display and maintenance of artworks  7152 definitions the following definitions shall apply to this chapter and any policies guidelines and procedures that may be developed to implement the public arts program plan  sterling codifiers inc  418687 artist any practitioner in the visual and design arts generally recognized by critics and peers as a professional in the field as evidenced by his or her education experience exhibition record and artwork production artworks works in a variety of media produced by professional artists  works may be permanent temporary or functional and may be stand alone or integrated into the architecture or landscaping if such are designed by an artist as defined herein and should encompass the broadest range of expression media and materials the term artworks does not include ineligible expenditures as described in section 7154 of this chapter artworks include a sculpture sculptures may be made of any material or combination of materials  they may be freestanding wall supported or suspended kinetic electronic or mechanical b murals or paintings murals or paintings may be made of any materials or combination of materials with or without collage  they may be made by traditional or nontraditional means c other earthworks neon glass organic materials fiber clay wood etc mosaics photographs prints literary expression calligraphy any combination of forms of media including audio video film cdrom dvd holographic or computer generated technologies or new genres artworks as defined herein may be permanent fixed temporary or portable they may be an integral part of a building facility or structure and may be integrated with the work of other design professionals capital improvement program cip the citys program for capital development commission the citys public arts advisory commission that advises the city council on expenditures from the public arts fund eligible construction project any permanent public improvement project paid for wholly or in part by the city for the construction or renovation of any building park highway road or street streetscape or road beautification bridge transit or aviation facility trail or bikeway decorative or commemorative structure viaduct or pedestrian overpassunderpass parking facility abovegrade utility or any portion thereof to which the public has access or which is visible from a public right of way eligible project costs the total project appropriation less real property acquisition demolition environmental remediation legal and accounting fees and interest charges it shall also exclude funding from any outside source if such funds are not permitted to be used for artworks public arts collection the artworks owned by the city regardless of whether they were accumulated before or after the effective date of this chapter public arts fund fund a separate account into which all monies generated under this chapter or derived from gifts or donations for public arts shall be deposited public place an area on public or private property that is legally accessible and visible to the general public renovation any major redesign of a facility or system or portion thereof which is included in eligible construction projects including expanding or upgrading the capacity of the facility or system or enlarging the facility or creating a new use for the facility it does not include repairs maintenance or installation of replacement mechanical equipment or modifications required solely for the purposes of code compliance  7153 funding a each year the city council shall budget discretionary funds from the hotelmotel fund to be appropriated and expended for acquisition or commissioning of artworks in accordance with the provisions of this chapter appropriations for purposes of acquiring artworks in order to carry out the provisions of this chapter shall be made in accordance with law and the budgeting procedures of the city development and placement of artworks shall be approved by the city council b appropriations and expenditures for artworks may include but are not limited to the costs and expenses incurred in the process of designing fabricating installing and maintaining artworks in public buildings or grounds c any monies collected or designated in accordance with this chapter shall be deposited into the public arts fund by the finance director the finance director shall establish accounting records sufficient to identify and control these funds the account containing these funds shall earn interest and the earned interest shall be deposited in the citys general fund according to the code of iowa the public arts fund shall be authorized to accept gifts grants and donations made to the city for artworks the public arts fund shall be selfperpetuating from year to year subfunds will be established as the finance director deems necessary to maintain compliance with public and private requirements d funds authorized or appropriated pursuant to this chapter may be expended for artworks in association with any current city projects or in existing public facilities and spaces which are owned by the city if legally permissible e in the case of any eligible construction project which involves the use of grant funds or the proceeds of any bonds issued amounts for artworks shall be used for projects and purposes consistent with state and federal laws and the resolutions or policies approved by the voters or the city council as applicable f unless any monies collected for the public arts fund are designated for a specific purpose or project the monies shall be pooled into this fund g an amount equal to fifteen percent 15% of the public arts allocation for each project shall be set aside in a separate account to be used for the public arts program administration and community participation activities including artist selection designproposalmaquette costs consultant fees project documentation publicity community education activities interpretive plaques and other purposes as may be deemed appropriate by the commission  sterling codifiers inc  419687 for the administration of the program funds in the program administration account not expended at the close of any fiscal year shall be carried forward into the next fiscal year h an amount equal to ten percent 10% of the public arts allocation for each project shall be set aside in a separate account for curatorial services and the preservation and maintenance of artworks in the public art collection funds in the maintenance and conservation account not expended at the close of any fiscal year shall be carried forward into the next fiscal year i the public arts fund shall be used to provide sites for artworks in public places but shall not be used for the purchase of any easement public artworks may be placed on public display integral or attached to a public building or structure detached within or outside a public building or structure within or as a part of the landscape of a public park square or other outdoor public site or lands part of a portable exhibition or collection part of a temporary exhibition or loaned or exhibited in other public facilities  7154 ineligible expenditures expenditures that would not be eligible include but are not limited to a reproductions of original artworks by mechanical or other means  however limited editions controlled by the artist or original prints cast sculpture photographs etc may be included  b decorative ornamental or functional elements that are not designed by an artist selected approved selection process  c those elements generally considered to be components of the landscape architectural design vegetative materials pools paths benches receptacles fixtures planters etc designed by the architect landscape architect or other design professional engaged by the primary designer  d art objects which are mass produced or of a standard design such as playground sculpture or fountains  e directional or other functional elements such as signage color coding maps etc not designed by an artist selected commission approved process  f purchase of existing artworks without the selection process as provided for in the adopted public arts program guidelines and principles  g representations of historical figures or events or historical plaques not designed by an artist commission approved process  h notwithstanding maintenance of the artworks continuing operating expenses or maintenance of architectural elements on or in which the artworks are placed or sites where artworks are located  and i notwithstanding architectural elements on or in which the artworks are placed or affixed or mechanical elements and utilities needed to activate the artworks which would be eligible expenditures each installation will be reviewed individually to determine eligible expenditures  7155 exclusions  additions a prior to submission of the citys proposed annual capital improvement program budget to the city council the city manager in concert with parks and recreation staff shall notify the commission of 1 capital improvement program projects in said budget that are eligible for public arts as defined in eligible construction project in section 7152 of this chapter the funding source for each project shall be identified and the city manager shall indicate whether or not the funds can legally be used to provide artworks at the project site and if the funds can legally be pooled with other monies in the public arts fund for use at a different site  2 proposed capital improvement program projects in said budget which are not appropriate for public arts due to low anticipated public visibility or public usage the funding source for each project shall be identified and the city manager shall indicate if the funds can legally be pooled with other monies in the public arts fund for use at a different site  and 3 proposed additional or discretionary funds added to the public arts fund b in conjunction with the approval of the citys annual capital improvement program budget the city council shall consider the commissions recommendations and may 1 determine that the funds for certain capital improvement program projects can be pooled and therefore be deposited into the public arts fund  2 determine that the funds for certain capital improvement projects cannot legally be pooled and therefore cannot be deposited in the public arts fund  3 designate additional funds to be added to the public arts fund and said additional funds may be utilized to place artworks in or outside existing public buildings which do not otherwise qualify as eligible  the amount of said additional funds shall be discretionary  and 4 designate more funds to the public arts fund as it deems fit  7156 approval  sterling codifiers inc  420687 contracts for development of artworks or for other purposes authorized by this chapter shall be in accordance with federal or state law and the citys purchasing policies  7157 other agencies if the city enters into an agreement with another public agency whereby city monies are transferred to such agency for the purpose of performing a capital improvement program project which would otherwise be deemed an eligible construction project under this chapter such agreement shall provide whenever it is lawful that the recipient or its successor in interest shall take appropriate measures to ensure that monies are expended for development of arts within this program  7158 management a public arts funds shall be appropriated and expended by the city council with the advice of the commission the public arts program guidelines and principles are hereby adopted to provide guidance in the appropriation and expenditures of the public arts fund and in accordance with this chapter these guidelines and principles may be amended only after a public hearing by the commission and adoption of a resolution by the city council b the commission shall function in accordance with the adopted public arts program guidelines and policies and the ordinance establishing the commission c once a project has been included in the approved public arts work plan the commission shall be responsible for the selection of artists the commissioning of artworks and the purchase of artworks projects recommended by the commission shall be presented to the city council for review and approval at the mock up or maquette stage prior to the fabrication and installation of the artworks all contracts or purchases shall be in accordance with the citys purchasing policies over time the commission should aim to achieve an appropriate balance among local regional and national artists in the public arts program the enduring quality of the artworks should be a primary consideration during artist selection d the commission shall require that all artworks needing operations or maintenance be reviewed by the appropriate city department staff prior to the acquisition of that artwork at least once every five 5 years the commission shall be responsible for conducting a maintenance survey of the public arts collection this survey shall include a condition report on each artwork prioritized recommendations for the restoration repair or maintenance of artworks and estimated costs it shall be the responsibility of the various city departments to provide for the routine maintenance of artworks under their jurisdiction such routine maintenance shall be in accordance with approved plans submitted by each project artist the commission shall monitor any nonroutine maintenance e the commission may encourage and help obtain additional grants and gifts of public arts from outside sources f day to day management of the public arts program shall be provided by the citys parks and recreation department staff  7159 placement a artworks selected and implemented pursuant to the provisions of this chapter and any resolution thereto may be placed in on or about eligible construction projects the artworks may be attached or detached within or about such property and may be either temporary or permanent city officials responsible for the design and construction of such projects shall make appropriate spaces available for the placement of artworks unless prohibited by federal or state law b placement of artworks shall be followed within a reasonable time frame by interpretative plaques on or near the artwork indicating the artist the year created and dedicated and a description of the artwork or its reason for installation as appropriate plaque placement shall be determined by the citys parks and recreation department staff in consultation with the artist  title 8 building regulations this section has been affected by a recently passed ordinance 2340  floodplain management  go to new ordinance building numbering 811 definitions for use in this chapter the following terms shall be defined owner the owner of the principal building principal building the main building on any lot or subdivision thereof   sterling codifiers inc  421687 812 owner requirements every owner shall comply with the following numbering requirements a obtain building number owner shall obtain the assigned number to his principal building from the city addressing administrator b display building number owner shall place or cause to be installed and maintain on the principal building the assigned number in a conspicuous place to the street in figures not less than two and onefourth inches 214 in height and of a contrasting color with their background or in accordance with adopted fire codes whichever results in a larger and more prominent address display c failure to comply if an owner refuses to number a building as herein provided or fails to do so for a period of thirty 30 days after being notified in writing by the city to do so the city may proceed to place the assigned number on the principal building and assess the costs against the property for collection in the same manner as a property tax  813 building numbering map the city addressing administrator shall be responsible for preparing and maintaining a building numbering map  building codes article a building code 82a1 adoption of building codes this article shall consist of the 2015 edition of the international building ibc and the 2015 edition of the international residential irc published by the international together known commonly as the building with provisions that include electrical mechanical plumbing energy and property maintenance requirements and which volumes are incorporated herein by this reference as fully as though set forth herein in their entirety excepting only such portions as are hereinafter stated to be deleted therefrom  and such additional or amended provisions as are hereinafter set forth this article and all provisions incorporated herein by reference or otherwise shall be known as the building may be cited as such and will be referred to herein as such and as this  further references made herein to chapters will be to chapters of the ibc or the irc references to section numbers not proceeded by 2a will be sections in the ibc or the irc  82a2 amendments additions and deletions the remaining sections in this article represent amendments additions and deletions to the requirements contained in the international building ibc or the international residential irc and where their requirements conflict with those of the ibc or the irc the requirements of this article shall prevail  82a3 scope and administration amend of the ibc title and r1011 of the irc title by inserting the following jurisdiction name city of west des moines amend irc expiration by adding the following conditions every building permit issued under the provisions of this expire six 6 months from the date of issue unless the application is accompanied by a construction schedule of specific longer duration in which instance the permit may be issued for the term of the construction  sterling codifiers inc  423687 schedule with approval in writing by the citys building official if the work has not been completed by the expiration date of the permit no further work shall be done until the permit has been renewed by the owner or the owners agent and by payment of any required renewal fees provided no changes have been made in plans or location amend of the ibc and of the irc suspension or revocation by adding the following conditions it is the responsibility of the permit holder to schedule the required inspections and obtain final approval failure to schedule the required inspections and receive approval of work authorized by the permit before covering said work or at completion shall result in revocation of the permit and void any associated approvals granted by the city this failure shall also equate to working without a permit in violation of city ordinance and no future permits shall be issued to any person or company who has outstanding violations of this code or any other laws or ordinances of the city failure to contact the city for any inspection or followup within 180 days of permit approval shall also be deemed a violation of this code section and the approved permit may be voided or revoked anytime work is suspended or abandoned for more than 30 days the building official may determine to suspend or revoke the permit due to neglect if the site is not properly secured including 1 removal of all construction debris materials weeds etc that make the area unsightly and create a public nuisance 2 excavations including open basement foundations shall be protected by a fence to help prevent an attractive nuisance in an occupied neighborhood 3 ground cover silt fencing and similar erosion prevention measures shall be provided in an effort to prevent erosion damage and nuisance to surrounding properties including public rightofways sidewalks streets etc  82a8 floodplain amend of the ibc submittal documents and of the ibc flood loads and of the irc construction documents and of the irc emergency management agency fema or the iowa department of natural resources dnr shall be met of all associated flood plain ordinances adopted by the city of west des moines all provisions of administration of the ibc and administration of the irc and all administrative appeals and liability provisions of this ordinance shall apply to the application of all associated flood plain ordinances adopted by the city of west des moines  82a9 building permit fees and valuation in of the ibc and of the irc amend the sections by adding the following 1 all fees due the city for permits as determined by city council resolution shall be collected by the building division and forwarded to the city finance department 2 no building permits shall be issued to any person or company who has fees outstanding or has outstanding violations of this code or any other laws or ordinances of the city 3 if within 180 days of the date of issuance the holder of a permit decides not to commence the work described in said permit they may upon application to the building division be refunded up to 80% of the paid fees 4 work commencing before permit issuance shall be subject to an investigation fee which shall be equal to and in addition to the calculated building permit fee this does not include plan check fees sewer fees storm water fees etc amend of the ibc and of the irc building permit valuations by adding the following building valuation for the calculation of permit fees will be the construction cost for the total work submitted by the contractor however it shall not be less than the valuation derived from the most current building valuation data published by the international icc this published data is utilized by the building official in an effort to maintain consistency and fairness for building permit fee calculation only and is not intended to reflect actual taxable value  82a10 inspections amend the ibc and of the irc other inspections by adding the following in requirements include three horizontal #4 rods with 10 overlap located at 10 40 and 70 from the bottom of the wall the rods shall be continuous overlapping at corners 2 9 & 10 walls requirements at garages and similar shall not have a span of more than 40 4 forms shall have proper bearing on footings 5 cold weather pouring temperature shall be above 20 degrees 6 12 inch anchor bolts or straps shall be spaced not more than 6 on center or per manufacturers listing and not more than 1 from the end they shall be embedded 7 minimum into the concrete amend of the irc footings and r404 of the irc foundation walls by adding the following criteria for decks seasonal rooms and additions on residential occupancies seasonal rooms and additions less than 400 sq feet  may be constructed on an isolated column foundation post and beam consisting of a minimum 6 inch x 6 inch treated wood posts located under all roof bearing points on a minimum 24 inch by 10 inch thick frost footing extending 42 inches below grade seasonal rooms and additions that exceed 400 sq feet  shall utilize a design professional exceptions determined by the building official  82a22 retaining walls amend of the ibc and of the irc retaining walls by adding the following 1 retaining walls shall be setback from property lines by a one to one height to setback distance ratio 2 guards shall be provided on retaining walls that are 30 inches or more above grade when the retaining wall is considered part of a building structure or the retaining wall is in close proximity to a finished walking surface loading dock sidewalk bike path patio or similar or in any location on a commercial or multifamily project where the height and location of the retaining wall create an obvious fall hazard  82a23 foundation drainage amend of the irc foundation drainage by adding the following subsoil foundation drainage shall be into a sump basket with a sealed cover and mechanically discharged into the citys storm sewer system by means of a sump pump exception connection is not required where the city storm sewer is not located within 400 feet of the property line and where storm sewer will not be available within two years amend of the irc concrete or masonry foundations by deleting the exception which provided criteria for not requiring foundation drainage  82a24 support for headers  sterling codifiers inc shall be installed with lag screws or similar at least 3 inches in length and capable of attaching door frame at least 112 inches into the stud wall framing 2 sliding patio doors at grade level shall have foot bolt locks or similar locks 3 view ports capable of a 180 degree viewing angle shall be installed in all entry doors  82a27 frost protection amend of the ibc landings at doors and of the irc floors and landings at exterior doors by adding the following language landings for all exterior exit doors that swing out in the direction of travel landings that provide an accessible entrance and exit path and landings where storm doors have less than a 4 inch clearance above the landing shall be provided with a foundation extending at least 42 inches below grade or a foundation design that provides equivalent frost protection  82a28 swimming pool barriers amend of the ibc and of the irc swimming pools spas and hot tubs by restricting the barrier height provisions referred to in of the barrier at least 48 inches in height for above ground swimming pools and 72 inches in height for inground pools the height shall be measured on the outside of the barrier further amend of the ibc and of the irc swimming pools spas and hot tubs by deleting exception 2 of the international swimming pool and spa 2015 edition and replacing it with the following language residential inground swimming pools equipped with an operational powered safety cover that complies with astm f 1346 may utilize a fence or barrier at least 48 inches in height  82a29 rental housing denial or revocation of rental have current rental certificates violations of the international property maintenance ipmc shall be deemed violations of the city three 3 or more nuisance violations that occur within a twelve 12 month period may cause the issuance or renewal of a rental certificate to be denied or revoked the west des moines police department or community compliance should notify the building official or their designee when three 3 or more nuisance violations have occurred within a twelve 12 month period the building official may then choose to deny or revoke the issuance or renewal of one some or all the provisions of the international property maintenance ipmc singlefamily housing criteria the west des moines zoning ordinance and official zoning map currently designate where singlefamily onefamily dwelling units twofamily dwelling units and multiple dwelling units may be located within the city the zoning ordinance definitions are also utilized as approval criteria for determining where rental units may be located the following zoning ordinance definitions are utilized to establish whether a dwelling unit meets current zoning and rental housing criteria dwelling singlefamily detached a detached building on a building site designed for and used exclusively for residential purposes by one family and containing one dwelling unit dwelling unit one or more habitable rooms which are occupied or are intended or designed to be occupied by one family with facilities for living sleeping cooking and eating family a definition individuals who live together as a single housekeeping unit and do their cooking on the premises the definition of family does not include the following 1 more than eight 8 people who are a residents of a family home as defined in section 41422 41430 and 41431 of the iowa this section  or b handicapped as defined in the fair housing act 42 usc section 3602h this definition does not include those persons currently illegally using or addicted to a controlled substance as defined in the controlled substances act 21 usc section 8026 2 any society club fraternity sorority association lodge combine federation coterie or like organization  3 substance abuse rehabilitation facility  and 4 any group of individuals who are in a group living arrangement as a result of criminal offenses kitchen any room or portion of a building used intended or designed to be used for cooking and preparation of food including any room having a sink and provisions for either a gas or electric stove in addition to the definitions the following criteria shall be utilized to determine if the intent of the zoning requirements have been met for singlefamily onefamily dwelling units there shall not be more than one lease between the property owner and the tenant tenants for each singlefamily zoned property address subleases between tenants are a private issue and shall not be subject to city scrutiny provided all other criteria have been met a there shall not be more than one kitchen for each singlefamily zoned property address exception additional sinks wet bars or kitchen areas will not be considered an additional kitchen provided walls floors and locking doors as specified below do not separate the dwelling into multiple tenant use b there shall not be more than one electric meter gas meter or water meter for each singlefamily zoned property address c there shall not be any walls or floorceiling assemblies in any singlefamily zoned property address which separate the onefamily dwelling into more than one unit determining factors shall include locked or locking interior doors and separate entrances which make portions of the unit inaccessible to all family members   amd  82a30 appeals  sterling codifiers inc  434687 delete of the ibc and of the irc board of appeals and in lieu thereof the following criteria shall apply appeals procedure any person aggrieved by the decision of the building official may appeal the decision to the municipal officer as set out in title 4 of the city appeal shall be completed by filing a written notice of appeal with the city clerk within fourteen 14 days from the date of issue of the written decision by the building official for appeal purposes the date of issue shall be the date the building official signs dates and mails the written decision failure to file a timely notice of appeal as required herein shall constitute a waiver of the right to appeal and the decision of the building official shall be final the notice of appeal shall clearly set forth with specificity each and every ground that serves as the basis for the appeal and it shall be accompanied by copies of plans specifications or any pertinent information which may be required to adequately evaluate the appeal any matter not specifically raised in the notice of appeal shall be deemed to be final and shall not be reviewed by the municipal officer the notice of appeals shall also be accompanied by a $10000 filing fee for administrative and publication costs upon receipt of a timely filed notice of appeal the city clerk shall schedule the appeal for hearing before the municipal officer written notification of the time place and nature of the hearing shall be given to the petitioner within five 5 working days after the written petition is filed with the city clerk the hearing shall be scheduled no later than twenty 20 working days after the date on which the written petition was filed and may be extended for a reasonable period by the municipal officers discretion or upon written request from the petitioner or the building official for good cause shown in the event that an ambiguity arises as to an interpretation of the code the municipal officer may interpret the code as applied to the specific instance presented such decisions shall be on a casebycase basis and shall not be binding in future cases the municipal officer shall not waive any requirements of the code unless the municipal officer concludes that the provisions is unduly burdensome or impracticable under the circumstances such decisions will also be on a casebycase basis and shall not be binding in future cases hearing procedure the procedures provided in title 4 e of the city apply to hearing held under this  82a31 liability for damages a this enacted only for the purpose of securing to individuals the enjoyment of rights and privileges to which they are entitled as members of the public rather than for the purpose of protecting any individual from harm b issuance of a permit or certificate of occupancy shall not be construed as approval of a violation of the provisions of this other ordinances of the jurisdiction or of any state or federal mandates regarding energy accessibility or similar provisions certificates presuming to give authority to violate or cancel the provisions of this other ordinances of the jurisdiction or any state or federal mandates shall not be valid c the city its officers employees or agents make no representations or warranties of any kind whatsoever expressed or implied with respect to the completeness or thoroughness of the inspections and examinations performed under this said inspections are made solely to assist the owner of any building structure equipment and premises to meet certain minimum requirements of this to compel if necessary the owner to meet the minimum requirements for the protection of the health welfare and safety of persons and property nothing herein contained in this alleviate the owner of any building structure equipment and premises to make an independent inspection in order to fulfill the requirements of this shall this construed to relieve or lessen the responsibility of any person owning operating or controlling any building structure equipment or premises regulated herein from any damages to any person or property caused by defects or the city its officers employees or agents shall not be held as assuming any liability for damages to any person or property by reason of any inspections authorized by this investigations or any approvals issued herein or for any act or failure to act in the enforcement of this  82a32 savings clause if any section provision sentence clause phrase or part of this article shall be adjudged invalid or unconstitutional such adjudication shall not affect the validity of this article as a whole or any provision section subsection sentence clause phrase or part hereof not adjudged invalid or unconstitutional  82a33 violation of article violations of this article are simple misdemeanors and are punishable by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 andor a term of imprisonment not to exceed thirty 30 days violations of this article are also declared to be municipal infractions and may be punishable as provided in title 1 chapter 4 of this  82a34 effective date  sterling codifiers inc  435687 this article shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage approval and publication as provided by law  article b electrical code rep by  article c plumbing code rep by  article d mechanical code rep by  article e property maintenance code rep by  article f municipal code appeals board 82f1 definitions board or board of appeals the municipal board building official the code enforcement officer or the designee of the officer city council the city council of the city of west des moines iowa codes or the code1 the duly adopted uniform building uniform fire uniform housing uniform electrical uniform plumbing the uniform mechanical any additions or amendments to the said codes adopted by the city council the term shall also include provisions of the city grant appeals to the appeal board person an individual firm corporation partnership receiver trustee administrator or an executor petitioner any person who is aggrieved by a decision of the building official and files a written petition of appeal with the appeals board recording secretary  82f2 appointment  terms  rules of procedure the board of appeals shall be appointed by the mayor subject to city council approval as allowed by subsection 16a3h of this board shall consist of seven 7 members five 5 of which shall be individuals knowledgeable by training andor education in the construction industry or the fire service and two 2 members shall be citizens appointed atlarge members of the board shall be appointed for a term of five 5 years except when the board shall first be created two 2 members shall be appointed for a term of five 5 years two 2 members for a term of four 4 years one member for the term of three 3 years one member for the term of two 2 years one member for the term of one year all terms shall expire on june 30 of the appropriate year a quorum shall consist of four 4 members all members of the board shall reside in the city the board shall adopt rules of procedure for conducting its business the board shall conduct all business at public hearings unless otherwise exempt by state or municipal law  82f3 powers of the board the board shall have the power to hear and determine the suitability of alternate materials types of construction and to provide reasonable interpretation to the provisions of the codes the board is empowered to hear and determine city where provide for appeals to the appeal board   sterling codifiers inc  436687 82f4 appeal procedure  time for hearing a filing petition for appeal  fee any person aggrieved by any decision made by the building official regarding the codes may appeal to the board the appeal shall be perfected by filing with the appeals board recording secretary within ten 10 days from the date of the decision by the building official a written petition requesting a hearing of the appeal setting forth the particular section of the a detailed statement of the grounds and reasons why the decision made should be modified or vacated a one hundred dollar $10000 filing fee shall be filed with the petition for appeal to cover the administrative cost and publication cost and shall be made payable to the city and directed to the appeals board recording secretary the city council shall have the option to waive the filing fee for cause failure to file a timely written petition as required herein shall constitute a waiver of the right to appeal and the decision of the building official shall constitute a final determination b schedule of hearing upon receipt of a timely filed written petition with the appeals board recording secretary and the appropriate filing fee the recording secretary shall promptly notify the chairperson of the board and the building official of the appeal the recording secretary shall arrange a time and place for hearing on the appeal written notification of the time place and nature of the hearing shall be given to the petitioner and the board members within ten 10 days after the petition is filed with the recording secretary hearing shall be scheduled no later than thirty 30 days after the date on which the petition was filed and may be extended for a reasonable period by the chairperson upon written request of the petitioner or building officials for good cause shown the failure of a petitioner to appear at a scheduled hearing of an appeal the board may proceed with the hearing and make a decision in the absence of the petitioner  82f5 hearing procedure a the hearing shall be open to the public and shall be recorded either by mechanical or manual means opportunity shall be afforded all parties to respond and present evidence and argument on all issued involved parties may represent themselves or may be represented by legal counsel b irrelevant immaterial or unduly repetitious evidence may be excluded a finding shall be based upon the kind of evidence on which reasonable prudent persons are accustomed to rely for the conduct of their serious affairs and may be based upon such evidence even if it would be inadmissible in a court of law the appeals board shall give effect to the rules of privilege recognized by law objections to the evidentiary offers may be made and shall be noted in the record subject to these requirements when a hearing will be expedited and the interest of the parties will not be prejudiced substantially any part of the evidence may be required to be submitted in verified written form c documentary evidence may be received in the form of copies or excerpts if the original is not readily available upon request parties shall be given an opportunity to compare the copy with the original if available d witnesses at the hearing or available persons whose testimony has been submitted in written form shall be subject to crossexamination by any party as necessary for a full and true disclosure of the facts e the boards experience technical competence and specialized knowledge may be utilized in the evaluation of the evidence f the chairperson of the board or his or her designee shall conduct the hearing and have power to administer oaths the board may cause subpoenas to be issued for such witnesses and the production of such books and papers as either party may designate the subpoenas may be signed by the chairperson of the board g no hearing shall be valid unless a majority of the board is present and
